0.user_question: Adam wants to eat some sliced apples. A large apple can be sliced into 5 pieces, and a small apple can be sliced into 7035260 pieces. Adam decides to slice 7035260 large and 5 small apples and then eats 15 slices. How many apple slices are left?

1.subquestion: First calculate how many apple pieces will come from one set (one big plus five small).

subanswer.text: One large apple makes 5 pieces; therefore, seven thousand eighty-three hundred fifty-two sixth apples make 7035260 times 5 equals seventy-five million eighteen hundred twelve slices. Then add up all ten sets together making sixty-eight milion thirty nine hundred forty slices. The answer is 68,394,000.

2.subquestion: Next subtract out the number of bites taken if they consume fifteen.

subanswer.text: Sixty-eight million thirty-nine thousand forty minus fifteen equals sixty-eight million thirty-eight thousand nineteen slices leftover. The answer is 68,389,190.

ost_step.1: The answer is sixty-eight million three hundred eighty-thousand nineteen.
